header.title: Golden Globe Award for Best Actor - Motion Picture Musical or Comedy

signal.bdy:
The
Golden Globe Award for Best Actor - Motion Picture Musical or Comedy was first awarded by the
Hollywood Foreign Press Association
as a separate category in
1951
. Previously, there was a single award for "Best Actor in a Motion Picture" but the splitting allowed for recognition of it and the
Best Actor - Drama
.
The formal title has varied since its inception and as of 2005 is officially called: "Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy".
